publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7972 Linda Fabiani: John Mason, A Musical Legacy—That the Parliament expresses its sadness at the death of John Mason, founder and musical director of the Scottish Fiddle Orchestra; considers that John was dedicated to his music and hisorchestraand,over-the-years,entertained many thousands of people while raising considerable sums for charity; further applauds his talent in writing and arranging many tunes that have become standards in the traditional music canon, and offers respect, sympathy and condolences to his family and many friends.
S3M-7972 John Mason, A Musical Legacy (lodged on 21 February 2011) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-7972 Linda Fabiani: John Mason, A Musical Legacy—That the Parliament expresses its sadness at the death of John Mason, founder and musical director of the Scottish Fiddle Orchestra; considers that John was dedicated to his music and hisorchestraand,over-the-years,entertained many thousands of people while raising considerable sums for charity; further applauds his talent in writing and arranging many tunes that have become standards in the traditional music canon, and offers respect, sympathy and condolences to his family and many friends. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn

S3M-7972 John Mason, A Musical Legacy (lodged on 21 February 2011) Peter Peacock*, George Foulkes*, Jamie McGrigor*, Patricia Ferguson*, Elaine Smith*, Rob Gibson*, Bill Kidd*, Liam McArthur*, Bill Wilson*, Pauline McNeill*, Nanette Milne*, Mike Pringle*, Stuart McMillan*, Mary Scanlon*, Robin Harper*
S3M-7972 John Mason, A Musical Legacy (lodged on 21 February 2011) Willie Coffey*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-7972 John Mason, A Musical Legacy (lodged on 21 February 2011) Maureen Watt*
